alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 12:55PM MST until July 30 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 1255 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire scar. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff. This includes the following highways... Highway 180 between mile markers 218 and 220. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Fire scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
